text: Thomas Earl Emmer Jr.Helgeson, Baird. "Tom Emmer: Riding a new populist wave" , Star Tribune, July 11, 2010. (born March 3, 1961) is an American attorney and politician. He has been the U.S. representative for since 2015. He has been the House Majority Whip since 2023. Emmer unsuccessfully ran for Governor of Minnesota in the 2010 election, however lost the election to Minnesota Democratic–Farmer–Labor Party nominee Mark Dayton by less than half of a percentage point. After the 2022 United States House of Representatives elections, he won the race for House Majority Whip. ==References== Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:United States representatives from Minnesota Category:Lawyers from Minnesota Category:Politicians from Indiana Category:Lawyers from Indiana Category:People from South Bend, Indiana Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Tom Emmer
